volsense_core.forecaster_core module

volsense_core.forecaster_core

Overview

This module provides a high-level wrapper and helpers for training and evaluating VolSense forecasting backends including:

  • BaseLSTM (ticker-specific recurrent forecaster)

  • GlobalVolForecaster (multi-ticker shared model)

  • ARCH-family forecasters (GARCH, EGARCH, GJR)

Public API

Classes
VolSenseForecaster

Unified interface to train, evaluate and persist different forecasting backends. Produces standardized forecast DataFrames on the realized volatility scale.

Functions
make_forecast_df(preds, actuals, dates, tickers, horizons, model_name)

Build a tidy evaluation DataFrame from model predictions and realized values. Used internally by VolSenseForecaster for consistent output formatting.

Usage

>>> from volsense_core.forecaster_core import VolSenseForecaster
>>> vf = VolSenseForecaster(method="global_lstm", device="cpu")
>>> vf.fit(training_df)
>>> df_results = vf.predict(evaluation_df)

Notes

  • All neural models expect inputs and features produced by the pipeline in volsense_core.data.feature_engineering.

  • Forecast outputs use the column schema: [‘asof_date’,’date’,’ticker’,’horizon’,’forecast_vol’,’realized_vol’,’model’].

class VolSenseForecaster(method='lstm', device='cpu', mode='eval', **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Unified forecasting API for BaseLSTM, GlobalVolForecaster, and GARCH family models.

All results are on realized (non-log) volatility scale. Output schema:

[‘asof_date’,’date’,’ticker’,’horizon’,’forecast_vol’,’realized_vol’,’model’]

Parameters:

  • method – One of ‘lstm’, ‘global_lstm’, ‘garch’, ‘egarch’, ‘gjr’.

  • device – ‘cpu’ or ‘cuda’.

  • mode – Default prediction mode (‘eval’ or ‘inference’).

  • kwargs – method-specific configuration (window, horizons, epochs, extra_features, etc.)

fit(data, **train_kwargs)[source]

Fit the selected forecasting model.

LSTM:

  • trains a per-ticker BaseLSTM.

Global LSTM:

  • trains a single GlobalVolForecaster across all tickers.

GARCH family:

  • fits a ticker-specific ARCH/GARCH variant.

Parameters:

data – pandas.DataFrame containing required columns (date,ticker,return,realized_vol).

Returns:

self (trained forecaster)

Return type:

VolSenseForecaster

Raises:

  • KeyError – missing extra_features columns.

  • ValueError – unknown method.

predict(data=None, mode=None)[source]

Generate forecasts (and realized-aligned evaluations when available).

LSTM: returns eval-set predictions for the trained ticker on realized scale. Global LSTM: performs rolling realized-aligned evaluation across tickers; requires data. GARCH family: returns rolling 1-day forecasts with realized vol alignment.

Parameters:

  • data (pandas.DataFrame or None) – Input DataFrame required for ‘global_lstm’ evaluation; ignored for ‘lstm’ and GARCH.

  • mode (str or None) – Optional override for prediction mode (unused in current implementations).

Raises:

  • ValueError – If ‘global_lstm’ is used without providing data, or if method is unknown.

  • RuntimeError – If GARCH model has not been fitted prior to prediction.

Returns:

Standardized forecast-evaluation DataFrame with columns [‘asof_date’,’date’,’ticker’,’horizon’,’forecast_vol’,’realized_vol’,’model’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

save(save_dir: str = 'models', version: str = 'latest', device: str = 'cpu')[source]

Save trained model and training artifacts in standardized VolSense formats.

Produces: - <stem>_full.pkl - <stem>_bundle.pkl - <stem>.meta.json + <stem>.pt

Parameters:

  • save_dir – Directory to store model artifacts.

  • version – Version tag (e.g., ‘v507’).

  • device – ‘cpu’ or ‘cuda’ (model will be moved to this device for serialization).

Returns:

meta dict produced by save_checkpoint utility.

Return type:

dict
